questions.prompt: Fill in the blank: 'There are _______ apples in the basket (a few/few).'
Spot the mistake: 'There are little people at the party.'
Change the sentence to include a quantifier: 'I have pens in my bag.'
questions.answer: I have a few pens in my bag.

questions.prompt: Fill in the blank: 'She has _______ friends in this city (a lot of/little).'
Spot the mistake: 'I have few milk for my coffee.'
Change the sentence to include a quantifier: 'They bought books.'
Fill in the blank: 'He drank _______ water during his workout (a lot of/a little).'
Spot the mistake: 'She ate a little cakes at the party.'
Change the sentence to include a quantifier: 'They have money.'
questions.answer: They have a lot of money.

questions.prompt: Fill in the blank: 'There are _______ mistakes in your essay (few/a few).'
Spot the mistake: 'I need a lot of advice for my project.'
questions.answer: a lot of (some or any, because 'advice' is uncountable)

questions.prompt: Change the sentence to include a quantifier: 'There are problems in the system.'
questions.answer: There are some problems in the system.

questions.prompt: Fill in the blank: 'There is _______ oil left in the bottle (a little/little).'
Spot the mistake: 'She has little knowledge about the subject.'
Change the sentence to include a quantifier: 'I need help with this task.'
questions.answer: I need some help with this task.

questions.prompt: Fill in the blank: 'There are _______ cookies left on the plate (a few/few).'
Spot the mistake: 'There are a few water in the glass.'
Change the sentence to include a quantifier: 'There is time before the meeting.'
questions.answer: There is some time before the meeting.

questions.prompt: Fill in the blank: 'There is _______ bread in the pantry (some/a few).'
Spot the mistake: 'They have a lot of information about the topic.'
